reviews.review_text: Beautiful space to dine in. It is a big and busy restaurant. The food came quickly, more quickly than I expected. I guess I cant complain about prompt service, but could have used more time to digest before the next dish came out. Dishes are served family style, so everyone had the opportunity to taste everything. Delicious food. Would definitely come again.

We ve taken my mom here on her birthday every year for the past 4 years and it has never disappointed. We book reservations as it can be busy! They have an amazing happy hour and a great menu - it s hard to choose between so many of their wonderful dishes. Lovely, helpful, and kind staff. Love coming here again and again! Favorites include beet salad and fried chicken. This was my first time getting their pizza and it was 10/10!

First time here, and all was excellent!  The restaurant is cozy and beautiful, and you can talk  comfortably  without so much noise.  The food is really delicious and the portions are big enough for two people. I recommend  the spaguetti and Kyoto 5-0 to drink. Make a reservation because it was full and with wait list.

We recently dined at Nightingale and I must say, the service was absolutely outstanding. The staff was incredibly attentive, making sure our every need was met throughout the evening. The food was beyond excellent, with the Margherita pizza stealing the show - it was cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor. The cocktails were also a highlight, as they were expertly crafted and incredibly refreshing. Overall, I highly recommend it to anyone looking for top-notch service, delicious food, and delightful cocktails.

Decided to celebrate my birthday at Nightingale and had a wonderful experience as always. There are so many things to try and somehow they manage to nail every single dish. The corn ribs are truly life changing. The atmosphere is interesting in a good way. Staff are kind and create a fun & unpretentious experience. Can t wait to try the chefs table next time I go!

I really loved the complexity and freshness of each dish. I ordered the beet salad, corn ribs, fried chicken, rigatoni, top sirloin steak, and caramel pot de creme. Every dish was well seasoned and flavorful. Portions were pretty generous as well. My favorite dish was the beet salad!

If you like the  White House  look on buildings, you will love the exterior entrance of Nightingale. Upon walking in, I couldn t help but notice the big, slightly backlit, warm toned bar that gives total New York restaurant vibes. My group and I were seated upstairs, with a view of the kitchen, chefs and all the yummy dishes being prepared. The fried chicken and hot honey pizza were a stand out for me. The gin cocktail will knock even the most gin enthusiast off of their feet though, so beware! Espresso martini was good as well as their other fruity little cocktails. Dessert was good, but then again, when isn t it ;)

The best dish of the night was baked sweet potato with mushroom XO sauce and chive creme fraiche. I would definitely come back to order this again! Halibut ceviche with avocado and plantain chips. It was okay. Apple, fennel, asiago cheese salad. Lovely taste. Purple haze cocktail and non-alcoholic passionfruit Palmer. Both were tasty. Came to $118 for two of us. Probably could ve ordered more.

A delicious experience. We sat on the upper floor with a view of the kitchen. We loved how energetic it was up here. The maple fried chicken and meatballs were a standout. The pizza and dessert were also tasty. We were met with great service throughout the evening.

Definitely the best sweet potato I have ever had. Honestly every dish was phenomenal and we tried 15 dishes! Can t wait to go back, highly recommend. Go with a group of 4 the dishes are perfect for sharing!

Amazing space and ambiance. Restaurant was very busy. Service is very good and quick. Not a whole of waiting from ordering food and having it delivered to your table. Recommend getting multiple dishes and splitting it amongst the group. Plenty of great items to enjoy.

Fantastic service, great ambience, amazing cocktails, and every single plate that was served screams attention to detail. The value was above my expectations as well. My only regret is that I didnt have a big appetite that night nor could I have more drinks. This will definitely be a stop every time Im in Vancouver!

The food is really good! Try for sure the fried chicken!! Spicy chorizo pizza is tasty! Cauliflower here is really good! Ceviche is good. I tried a lot of dishes and honestly they are really good, price wise is fair. The best thing is order many things to share so you can try more food.

Fabulous decor and layout. Food was also amazing from farm to table. But the server was very nice and had good recommendations. The pizza and bok choy plates were great. We also tried the elderflower desert and it was delicious! Lots of unique and solid foods to try here if you love Italian

We went there for a celebration. It was seamless from the flow of the service, presentation and taste and the dishes and the venue itself that is classy yet welcoming and warm. Extra note: if you choose the sirloin, I advice that you pair with a side of veg or something as it comes on its own. Or just wine ;)

We had a nice lunch with the Brussels sprouts, shisho peppers, fried chicken, pepperoni pizza, kids tomato spaghetti, clam spaghetti, pot de creme, earl grey cake. Everything was delicious. The Brussels sprouts was amazing a nice Asian vinegary flavour like dumpling sauce. The pizza was soft and light, slightly spicy pepperoni. Clam spaghetti was excellent with clam garlic butter flavoured sauce. Drank all the sauce. Kid s spaghetti tasted the same quality as the rest of the meal. My 3.5 year old finished the whole plate. Pot de creme was very creamy and very sweet but delicious and smooth if you like very sweet flavours. The earl grey cake was soft and moist. Definitely recommend as it has a very good balance of sweetness and flavours. Service was solid. A few different people came to serve the table aside from our main server. They gave us enough service without being overwhelming. Kid-friendliness: Kids menu with adult quality recipes, colouring page with crayons. Let my 3.5 year old choose the colouring page from 2 options.

Some of the best food I have eaten. We walked in on a Tuesday night because of its proximity to our hotel. We interacted with several staff, all of whom were delightful! We ordered the fried chicken, mushroom pizza, brussels sprouts, the earl grey cake dessert, and some mocktails. We were blown away by every single menu item we tried! The vibe/atmosphere was laid back yet classy. We even made another reservation so we could return before our trip was over. Love this restaurant and may buy the chef s cookbook because the creativity of the dishes was what set them apart.

We had a wonderful evening at this very cool and super popular stylish restaurant. If your budget can t stretch to the famous (and very expensive) Hawksworth Restaurant, then try it s sister restaurant Nightingale- it s the run by the same chef, but it s much easier on the wallet! It s a great space, and very lively too. Service was superb throughout the night and nothing was missed. The food was incredible; the buratta salad was divine, mushroom pesto pizza was heavenly, but the clam spaghetti pasta was sensational! And dessert was amazing too - the carrot cake & the salted caramel creme. Yum. Fantastic meal, and one of the highlights of our 5 day visit. It s definitely worth booking in advance.
Have been checking this place out for the 4th time now. Place is beautiful and the food variety is delicious. The menu is not over crowded. One of my fave dishes would be the steak

The best restaurant ever in Van! All foods are very fresh and full of flavour! My one of fav was watermelon salad which you should try! The server for our table was so kind, professional and knowledgable !

We walked in for an early dinner on Saturday and were immediately seated at a table overlooking the wood fired over upstairs. We were warmly greeted by our wonderful waiter (I regret not taking note of his name, but he mentioned he is from Columbia). The restaurant is lovely, with many different seating areas, all decorated tastefully without being pretentious. We were able to take advantage of the Happy Hour menu, which was full of cocktails and many food choices at a discount compared to the regular menu. The cocktails were beautifully prepared and very tasty. We proceeded to order the following: 1) Beets with whipped feta and dill -- fresh, lively and an outstanding opening to the meal. 2) Fried chicken -- a perfect portion for our family of four. Crispy and flavorful with a drizzle of maple syrup and topped with a pickle slice. This was the star of the meal. 3) Ketchup dusted fries with a delicious aoili -- delivered crisp and hot and perfectly spiced. 4) Blistered shishito peppers on a pool of tasty sauce -- beautifully prepared and a bountiful portion 5) Rigatoni Arrabiatta with a dollop of whipped ricotta. Spicy and cooked to perfection 6) Pizza with guanciale, pineapple and habanero. The perfect combination of spicy, salty and sweet. The dough of this neapolitan style pizza was delicious and had a great charred flavour and texture. 7) Pepperoni pizza -- delicious curled cups of pepperoni and just the right amount of onion. Pizza perfection. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Nightingale, made even better by the great server and rest of the staff, who made sure our glasses were always full and stomachs never empty. Vegetarian options: Salads on the menu and meat-free pizzas and pastas Kid-friendliness: Something for everyone in the family as a reasonable price

We just landed and wanted a couple of drinks and a snack before a late dinner.  I read good things, and we decided to stop in.  It was great - the hostess was nice and bartender was friendly and fantastic.  The meatballs and pizza bread hit the spot.  Were definitely interested in trying it for dinner the next time we come back to Vancouver.

Found this place for lunch and enjoyed the beet salad (fantastic, simple, and flavorful!) with the fried chicken.  Was so good I came back for dinner and had the margarita pizza (5 ) and the asparagus.   Food quality was all top notch and the service was also exceptional.  The bar was gorgeous.

Loved it. Walked in almost accidentally, thought we were out of our touristy league for a minute, but ended up being surprisingly affordable (relatively speaking, still not cheap) and incredibly delicious. Star of the show was for us the cauliflower - blew me away.

Awesome happy hour spot if you re looking for reasonably priced and delicious options! Unlike other restaurants within the same price range, nightendale offers a wide range of selections from cocktails to handhelds. We ordered the marinated olives, sweet potato and margarita pizza. The olives were well seasoned and came in a generous portion. The sweet potato was savoury and paired excellently with the sour cream sauce. Our favourite was the margarita pizza.. perfectly cooked! (ate it before I remembered to take a pic). Highly recommend you stop by if you re in the area!
Always a hit. Great place to share food and try new flavours. Upscale yet reasonable prices. An awesome place for bigger groups. Service was fantastic. The fried chicken and pizza are a must try!

Service was excellent! Food was delicious, the place is really cute, we were there for a late lunch and it was not too busy. Our waitress forgot to put our last dish in, so we never got it, luckily we had ordered plenty of food it wasn t needed.

We sat at the chef s table where you can watch the cooks prepare the dishes. It does get a bit warm but we found it interesting to watch as well as see which the most popular dishes were. The spaghetti alle vongele was the best we ve ever had and the carrot cake was exquisite.
Amazing service & food, loved celebrating my birthday here! Many vegetarian options. My favourites were the Roasted Brussel Sprouts & Ravioli.

Found Nightingale via Google maps and dropped in for dinner. After a short wait we were seated at the bar where we had WONDERFUL service! The food was fresh, fast, and full of flavor. Alexa made us delicious drinks as well. Would highly recommend if youre in the area!

Its a whole vibe and then some. Absolutely fantastic from the spot, to the atmosphere, to the drinks and food. Could not rate nor recommend this restaurant more highly. Will be returning to try the pizza next time and for the outstanding dessert menu as soon as we can make it back out there! For food recommendations: Cauliflower Hummus - my lord this was perfection. Korean Fried Chicken (KFC) also divine! Parmesan Fries, dip was an unexpected flavor profile that matched very well (warning a little salty for the heart), Baked Sweet Potato - fully loaded and a great mix of sweet and sour.

My partner & I went to Nightingale for our anniversary and it was the perfect place to celebrate a special occasion! The food & drinks were delicious (especially their pastas) and the service was friendly. I will definitely go again!

Nightingale was a lot of fun. The service was great. Very friendly and genuine. The food was great. Many restaurants tell you that their dishes are meant to be shared. But that usually works only for starters. In Nightingale, even the bigger portions, such as octopus or pork chop, come cut. So you actually can put them in the middle an share them without trouble. The cocktails were fun too. Double Oaked Old Fashioned lasted me through the evening. We were quite full, but decided to try just one dessert. Chocolate ganache was another nice surprise: theres chocolate, but there are also spices, and lemon sourness, and banana at the bottom.

Love the interior! Cozy and inviting. Food was stellar - I ve had brown butter butter squash in a million ways but somehow it was just much better here. Food is served family style, so you can get a bunch of things to try. Loved the creative cocktails. Service was attentive and our server (I didn t catch their name but they had short colourful hair) walked us through the menu and gave recommendations. Can t wait to come back.

This place is excellent. The food is delicious and the vibe is immaculate. We ordered the cauliflower hummus and mushroom pizza and they were so good. Drinks were spot on as well. Highly recommend the chefs table if you can swing it, they re a great spot to watch the  team work. Special shout-out to our server Oscar!  Great guy. Also definitely try the salted caramel pot de creme. So good!

We had a casual wedding dinner for about 15 people at Nightingale last week and it went perfectly! I love overseas, and the planning process was organized really well back and forth on email. The food was all shared, including salads, entrees (chicken, pizzas) and the mains were grilled trout or chicken. We had so much food I wish I could ve packed some up but we had an after party! The venue has a great atmosphere and although the private space doesn t have a closed off room, it s far from other diners and tucked in by the kitchen. Our servers were excellent too (shoutout to Gabriella and Riley!)
Great dining experience. The space was beautiful and the food was exceptional! Would definitely recommend

Great dining experience. The service was very good and prompt. They brought out the dishes in a timely manner. I want to go back and try the other things on the menu. A spot worth visiting when in Vancouver.

Had a lovely evening with delicious food and wonderful service. We decided to go a few days ahead and ended up with reservations at 4:30 - just in time for Happy Hour!!! We ordered the Guanciale Pizza, Fried Chicken Meatballs, Albacore Tuna, and the Spicy Ganache with Passionfruit Sorbet. Everything was well prepared, with great texture and flavours. The pizza did not disappoint  great chew and leoparding! And, the staff we re friendly and efficient, working as a team. Highly recommended  we ll be back.

This was a lovely surprise. Was looking through google to find some cool places to visit and I bumped into nightingale. The menu looked really appealing and we ended up parking right by it before a show. We decided to try it out and it was very very good, probably one of the top places I ve visited in Vancouver. Cala, was super lovely, helpful in pointing food allergens in the menu. The sweet potato and the goat cheese salad were our favorites. Definitely worth going to at happy hour which we didn t intend. Prices are definitely affordable, as well as the menu is designed to be family style so, the portions are worth it. Will definitely recommend and come back!
Best restaurant in all of Downtown! You will not be disappointed. Chef David Hawksworth is true Master of his trade

Great dining environment, background music is at the right volume Our server was very professional, fun and thorough.  After knowing my gf is allergic to cheese, he specifically marked down no cheese no the side of the order. The food quality is on par, well balance seasoning.  Pizza is definitely at the wow level. Will revisit again next month for my birthday meal LOL
Fantastic good. I don t normally like mushrooms but the mushroom ravioli was really well done and tasty. Good pizza too!
We visited this place for our anniversary dinner. Amazing food, nice service, aesthetic atmosphere.

First time coming here and we had an amazing experience! We were seated at the best seats, and our server Anna was so friendly and recommended all the different dishes to us and what we should order. We ended up choosing 5 dishes, and honestly, I cant decide which one is my favorite because theyre all so good. Again, our server Anna is extremely friendly and she kept checking on us to make sure were okay, and Im so grateful for that because we sat quite far from other people. All the food was amazing, service was excellent, ambience was spot on, and overall experience was awesome. Ill make sure to come back more often!

Nightingale is one awesome restaurant! I love their food. Anything you get here will be SO GOOD! The rigatoni all arrabatia literally reminded me of having it in Paris. Service is quick, and the waiters and waitresses are so kind and helpful. If you want to go hear be sure to get a reservation beforehand.

Came here for an early lunch and the restaurant wasn t too busy when we came. The service and food were good, but I was most impressed by their cocktails. I had the strawberry fields - it had sparkling wine with strawberry juice, dark chocolate and lemon. The taste was amazing! I heard the fried chicken was really good, sadly we didn t order it this time but hopefully next time!

The service was exceptional and what I remember the most. Our server and all staff were very friendly and helpful. The food was good and the atmosphere was excellent as well. Love the design and decor. Will definitely visit again when we are back in Vancouver!

First time going and was impressed food and service were both fantastic. Will definitely return. Sadly didnt get a picture of the buttermilk chicken was gone to fast. Went back again for lunch it was so good and added a picture of the buttermilk chicken this time.

What a Fantastic restaurant. The atmosphere had a lively vibe, the service was remarkable and the food DELICIOUS! And between my husband and I and a few delicately made cocktails the bill was quite reasonable. Definitely worth the drive from Surrey

My favorite restaurant I ve tried in Vancouver. The fried chicken was so moist and flavorful. I don t think I ve ever had fried chicken as fresh as this. We also ordered a margarita pizza, broccolini, and the carrot cake. I couldn t ask for a better meal. This place is perfection and best shared with friends and loved ones. The service is fantastic as well.

I loved loved loved this restaurant. Loved the meatballs (they have pine nuts inside) most of all. Great food, service and vibe. Went here by my lonesome but I had a great time. Definitely a cross between casual and fine dining.

A phenomenal fine dining experience with traditional true Canadian cuisine and favorites from our Great White North. Boasting  fantastic atmosphere, place to grub with super friendly staff, this place is a grand slam and worth treating yourself for sure. Support local businesses!
If you want a boogie night out, this is the place. Their clam spaghetti had me feeling things. Their fried chicken and fries were also really good. Cocktails were a little overpriced but still yummy
Food was delicious, wine too and our waiter was incredibly nice. I recommend!

This was the best experience I had dining in Vancouver. Michelin rated for a reason! Though the fried chicken is the most popular appetizer there, I wanted to try something new and different. The waiter recommended the Baked sweet potato and omg I have not had anything close to that in my life. We were scrapping every piece of it. Other dishes were delicious but the appetizer really did it. We received 5 star service, would definitely go back to Vancouver just for that sweet sweet potato! Just fyi, theres a parking lot nearby.
Amazing place! Amazing cuisine! Very friendly staff. I was very happy that I had an opportunity to visit this place! Just loved it!

We celebrated our anniversary today at Nightingale. Glad we booked a table for lunch because the dinner time was so popular and we couldn t make reservation. Our waitress ANNA is nice, helpful and very warm-hearted. We are impressed by her sense of humor also. The food is authentic as usual.  The pork cheek was very tender and tasty. However for people never tried Korean style fried chicken before, the buttermilk fried chicken will be fantastic. Otherwise I would save some stomach for the dessert. Lots of guests ordered their famous pizza, but we have only two persons so may leave for the next time.  And the reason we re glad to have lunch instead of dinner there, we still full after 5 hours.   Thank you Anna again. Glad to have you served us and we were pretty enjoy our talk.

This is a great casual spot that s a little more elevated than the usual franchise bistro fare downtown. The fried chicken, pizza and beet salad are so good. We had two drinks apiece and shared four dishes, and the final bill was surprisingly reasonable. Service was great, and the restaurant has a nice, busy atmosphere.

I would really recommend this place if youre into good European food. This place has best palate. We took buttermilk fried chicken and roasted mushroom pizza. And to end we ordered baked sweet potatoes. The quantity is enough for 2 but they do have small and large portion sizes available. Do check the happy hour menu if youre visiting in the afternoon. PS - this place have plethora of wines, you wont be disappointed.

Went to Nightingale from a friends recommendation and I was extremely happy.  This is a trendy restaurant with an eclectic menu.  I had the beet salad, spaghetti with clams and carrot cake.  All were excellent.  Especially the spaghetti is to die for. Highly recommended.

Nightingale is a modern trendy chef-driven establishment, eclectic clientele, with a classy staff. The staff engaged us in off-topic conversation and the whole experience left us with a great taste in our mouths for the rest of the evening.  Heres whats cool: The beet salad was exactly what you would expect, but  they sprinkled everything toping across the top, giving us a surprise crunchy savory onion/garlic/poppyseed experience. The baked sweet potato was exactly what you would expect, but... The salty taste of bacon was amplified by a subtle spice and Canadian sweetness. The morel mushroom risotto was somehow bright and flavorful even though risotto,  mushrooms, and asparagus are typically not. As a qualified rib expert (meaning I own a Traeger gill) who has traveled to South Carolina, Texas, and lived in Kansas City for 18 years, the ribs here blew my mind. I sincerely hope that everyone in the world gets to sit down with 18 yrs JP Wiser Canadian Whisky and enjoy these ribs: the meat had pull not tug, the fat was flavorful not greasy, and the sauce seemed homemade with traditional brown sugar, paprika, reduced tomatoes, and vinegar reduced down to a dry caramelization... but there was a good cumin flavor and something that appeared to us as lightly floral.

Just so good. Our server was so helpful and genuine, all of her recommendations were spot-on. We ordered the ceviche, roasted mushrooms, spaghetti, spicy salumi pizza, and salted caramel pot de creme. They recommend 3-5 dishes for 2 people and we took half the pizza home, so they were spot on. Everything was amazing, my partner and I couldnt pick a favourite dish. The pizza was fantastic and wouldve surprised me if I hadnt read reviews raving about it beforehand.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much, Hannah! We are delighted to hear you had such a wonderful experience, and hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: Nightingale was such a pleasant experience! The atmosphere was so fancy yet comfortable, and the staff were all so sweet and friendly. Food was spectacular, especially the morel mushroom risotto! Definitely coming back in the future.

Went out for dinner last weekend with my boyfriend and we had a very pleasant experience. The atmosphere was nice and the buttermilk fried chicken and spicy chorizo pizza was some of our favourites! We also had a very nice and friendly server named Karen and she recommended we dip our pizza crust in a tomato sauce that came with meatball and it was very amazing !

Nightingale is probably one of my top 5 restaurants in downtown Vancouver. First, I love family style sharing plates and second I dont think Ive eaten something here that I didnt like. The atmosphere is perfect for a date night, client lunch meeting or even a happy hour spot. Ive even taken my daughter here and brought some toys to keep her occupied. The brussel sprouts arent heavy and have a nice char. The beet salad is my favorite beet salad in Vancouver. Flavorful, creamy sauce and not too tart. The fried chicken is amazing with pickles and a slight hint of honey and not overly spicy seasoning. Every pizza Ive tried at Nightingale is amazing. Perfect Neapolitan pizza. I love their Margarita, but honestly they are all delicious. Salmon entree was likely sou vide which locked in all the juices and was so soft. Their seasonal item was the butternut squash tortellini and we almost had to order another dish. Service is amazing and Im never disappointed.

Ok, so we had 6 of us and ordered most of the appetizers, small dishes and a couple pizzas (the mains always sound just ok, so didn t bother). We had a great meal with some surprise hits and where blown away by how good the desserts are. Make sure to try the nettle tortellini and the Anchovy pizza

Went here for a friends birthday and the both of us thoroughly enjoyed our time and meal at Nightingale. The watermelon salad was delicious and interesting to begin with but I found it better as a cleanse between all the other foods we were eating. The fried chicken was okay, the spiced maple syrup tasted like chutney on the chicken so I didn t find it as good as other reviews have mentioned. The halibut ceviche was amazing, nice acidity balanced with the chip. It was a hit between the both of us. The steak and pork were delicious, it was very well prepared! Lastly the deserts were lovely! The lemon semolina cake was very nice as I enjoy more tart and sour flavours. The sweet basil yogurt ice cream was the star of that desert for sure. The ice cream sandwich was good, but the ice cream was a bit too hard to enjoy straight away but I understand it would be hard to have a clean cut of ice cream between two cookies if it wasn t. Overall the food came out fast, the atmosphere was nice and the server and staff were all kind and made the night enjoyable! Highly recommend!

We really liked this place. Superb atmosphere, excellent service and very special Brussels Sprouts. Maybe it is our own preference, felt the food was a bit salty. Same many of the food here. Butter milk Chicken was special to us too, very different from how we have it back in Malaysia

Extraordinary meal, beautiful, unique & every morsel delicious.  Wine list interesting and well-priced.  The restarant is beautiful, a lovely mix of contemporary & traditional touches.  Our server was professional & attentive.  The only reason I gave 4 stars on service was the disappointing lack of cleanliness in the restrooms.  But an amazing meal, highly recommend!

Went for a dinner with my friend, and the employees were so friendly. I love the cocktails, the Manila claim spaghetti, and the Brussel sprouts. I will bring some more people for the next time. Thank you for treating us well!

Visited Nightingale last night for the first time ever. The service from start to finish was impeccable. The atmosphere as soon as you walk in, is so cozy and warm! Absolutely beautiful decor and restaurant section ! We sat upstairs near the open kitchen which, in my opinion is always a bonus when eating out. The smell of the fresh pizzas coming out of the oven was to die for. We ordered: Buttermilk chicken Roasted sprouts Butternut squash pasta Pepperoni pizza Salted caramel pot Pistachio bar Carrot cake Everything was perfect and we will be back! Thanks!

My partner chose this place for a surprise birthday meal for myself. We were sat at the chef s table, which if you re sat in that section don t be disheartened. It s fantastic. The service was superb, wine selection was impossible to select a wrong glass or bottle.   The kitchen was organized,  and impeccably maintained. The expo chef even ran dishes if he had the time. As two people who ve worked in the service industry for over a decade, it s hard to be so impressed by a place like we were at the Nightingale. My sincere hats off to the entire team who work so hard to make their environment as warm and welcoming as it was. We will be back! Vegetarian options: So many flavourful options! My partner is vegetarian so I ate more vegetarian dishes than I normally would. We had the marinated beet salad with citrus and whipped ricotta. It was fantastic. My partner who does not enjoy beets loved it. They were marinated to take the dirty taste away but still left that classic earthiness. Dietary restrictions: Although no modifications are allowed on dishes, they are allergen safe and knowledgeable on which dishes you may have.

Incredible restaurant.  Killer cocktails and delicious food.  Service was great and easy to go with kids. Try to get there for happy hour as there are some great deals.  All the food was great but I especially recommend the cavatelli, wow!  Forgot to take a picture of the cavatelli but have pics of Nashville bites, pizza and loaded sweet potato.  All delicious. Kid-friendliness: They were great want having kids.  They gave us a bigger table than we had reserved and had kids chair. Honestly really hospitable.

I am addicted to their pizza. My favourite is Margaritas. I buy frozen ones at IGA to make it home, too. Their desserts are also very good. The restaurant is very open and lots of bird cages as decor that were fun to look at

Swung in for a late lunch at the bar. Amazing food! Staff was super engaging and shared their knowledge of the wine list which turned into a whole discussion and exploration on my part. So much good food here! (Not sure why photos in the bathroom are so popular, people are strange)
One of my favourite restaurants in Vancouver. Ive tried dinner several times here and they never disappoint.
Went for happy hour with a colleague for a holiday gathering.  Food was exceptional and so was the service and deco.  Definitely one of my favourite restaurant at downtown Van now.

One of the top 5 happy hours in Vancouver. Nightingale makes the mundane into gourmet. Fried chicken, margarita pizza and beets are my go-to every time. The cocktails are also solid. Dark and stormy for me! It is happiest during 3pm to 5:30pm. Get reservations to ensure your imbibing pleasures.

Food and drinks were hit or miss. I enjoyed the pizza and broccolini. The beets  were a bit too drenched in sauce and the pasta was cooked well but flavour was just salty. But the service made up for it. Drinks were excellent. Fantastic guest bartender.  Other one was great too!

It was our second time after which I said to the hubs if it s 3 for 3, that s it I am seriously going to buy the cookbook. Yup I am. First dish carrots the depth of flavors brought out with carrots like what?!?! Dish 2, the buttermilk fried chicken hubs said  chicken is just chicken til you cook it like this.  Dish 3 cavatelli bolognese perfectly al dente more like al dente to perfection no more like perfectly perfect and nice sauce with a kick. Then if your sweet sauce drizzle from the chicken melds with the heat from the bolognese you have it folks throw that fork down! Bahaha couldn t stop saying yum throughout the meal and wouldn t let the servers take away my plates with leftover sauce cuz I just wasn t done til the last drop. Not only that they have a kids menu!!!! My vegetarian toddler is going to eat up that kids menu chicken sans sauce like it s ice cream! And the service is impeccable friendly, courteous, relaxing, attentive in a subtle manner, even the host had us smiling and laughing before we got to the table. So if you haven t gone yet it s a family style eating hidden gem of a place in downtown Vancouver.

I have to say, I was blown away by the unique and delicious dishes they served. The fried chicken, sweet potato, and seafood spaghetti were particularly outstanding - the flavors were expertly balanced and the presentation was beautiful. The service was impeccable, with the staff being attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. They were able to provide great recommendations and answer any questions I had, making my dining experience even better. The atmosphere of the restaurant was also top-notch. It had a sleek and modern design with a comfortable and inviting feel. It was the perfect setting for a great dining experience. Overall, I had an exceptional experience at Nightingale Restaurant. From the incredible and unique food to the excellent service and fantastic atmosphere, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a top-notch dining experience. 5 stars all the way!

I dined here with my wife for our anniversary.  This place is fantastic for sharing a bunch of delicious items as most of the menu is made up of various small plates. We had an unhurried dinner sharing 6 dishes (although were too stuffed to finish the pasta with rabbit that came out last), and enjoyed a nice (and unexpectedly 50% off) bottle of red wine. All our dishes were fantastic and the service was excellent! The only very minor knock was that it was slightly loud (and would have given 4.5 stars on atmosphere but half-stars was not an option). We had a wonderful meal and definitely want to return again! I would highly recommend this place.

Great experience Our first choice was Joe Fortes but the wait was over an hour for 2 people- soooo glad we came here. The pics show what we ordered Amazing food. If you are vegetarian please try the fried chicken!!! OMG! The chicken was also vegetarian & it didn t eat meat sooo good One thing we noticed was that every server/staff if they caught your eye they would smile at you , exceptional service Even after we were finished another staff came by & filled up the waters even though it wasn t her table Great music great atmosphere One staff took my phone (after I asked what was the song playing) Shazammed it for me at a speaker. Love this place. Makes me wanna open a restaurant & emulate the energy.

Lovely dinner and drinks! A girlfriend and I went here early for happy hour and tried the fries, fried chicken, and pizza. Food was pretty good with the fried chicken being the best thing... was so flavourful! Drinks were awesome and perfectly made. We tried a small plate of the hand made butternut squash pasta as well and were blown away by the taste - definitely order this one even though it s not on the happy hour menu.

An amazing dining experience I wanted to try everything on the menu! The space is beautifully designed, and almost everything we ate was phenomenal! You can pass on the tuna, but the peri peri chicken was a highlight! Definitely a wonderful place to celebrate a special occasion and share delicious food with friends.

Excellent service; really fun/experimental food with good flavour & a sense of fun; really good value for the price. Yes, the price is on the high side but they deliver with quality as well as decent serving portions. Will come back again:) Recommend trying the water melon appetizer as well as halibut ceviche or the corn thing they have  if you want to try something new and fun.
Nicely decorated, comfortable, a bit noisy.  Food was delicious, love the pasta with clams, pork belly and pizza.  Service was excellent.  The only thing was that deserts were not in impressive.

Absolutely phenomenal in every way. Our service, from the hosts to the server and management was absolutely top notch. They helped with all of our questions, marked the menu for all of our allergies, and gave us time to talk and recommend things we were looking for. The food was sublime and the drinks were extremely well made. Absolutely will be back and recommend to anyone and everyone looking for great tapas and drinks! Thank you so much to the team at Nightingale for the memorable experience, we will for sure be back again!!

If you are visiting downtown Vancouver this place needs to be on your list. Food and cocktails are amazing. I was not able to make dinner reservations ( need to make far in advance), so appetizers and cocktails it was. We had the  Paper Plane  and  Bramble  cocktails which were amazing (especially loved the paper plane ) , and for appetizers enjoyed the Buttermilk fried chicken and warm marinated , spiced olives. I am not kidding when I say it was by far the best fried chicken we have ever had. I would love to know how they were able to cook it so light and not greasy   every detail of the recipe was perfect contributing to the flavour of the dish including the slice of pickle. I can t wait to go back and try some of the other cocktails on their list as well as different dishes. Lovely staff, location, and decor as well!

Elegant building, contemporary yet sophisticated ambiance inside with fireplace and high ceilings. Menu selection was a little limited for my taste buds. Portions were okay. They accommodated gluten free diet but not a whole lot of selection. Servers were quite knowledgeable about allergies which was comforting since my guest had gluten diet requirements. It s a nice treat to come here for special occasions but a little pricey for regularly dining.

To be honest, everything was incredible. The food was excellent (a touch salty for the pork belly and scallops) but the flavors were sublime. The pace felt just right and we were never rushed, even though we had to surrender our table we still had two hours to enjoy. The cocktails were just the right portion. I recommend the pizza especially if you like to share. Definitely will return!!

We love this place SO much. The fried chicken and the pizzas are to die for! Service is always top notch here too. For dessert, the salted caramel pot de creme is a must. You won t regret getting it! The washrooms are super clean here which means the kitchens must be super clean too. This is always our  go to  place for special meals: birthdays, anniversaries, extra special date nights.

Chic and elegant venue for many occasions. Large space: has tables upstairs and downstairs. Good good selection: pizza, salads and mains. This place does not serve brunch nor are there any breakfast foods on the menu so don t get set on eating eggs Reservations are highly recommended esp on weekends. Pay parking on the street (limited).

After a few attempts of getting a reservation finally got in on a slow Saturday afternoon.   They let us know that it s family style but we had a picky group so we ordered individually and it was fine.  The French fries were really good and loved the onion pizza.   The decor and ambiance inside is great with a nice and clean feel.  Definitely worth a visit.

This was a remarkable experience! This gem has been on my must-go place for a long while. My wife and I enjoyed some incredible hand crafted cocktails, the pizza was incredible - perfectly sauced, crunchy and cheesy. We had a bubbly server who was attentive and eager to accommodate us (we have some allergies that can sometimes be finicky) nonetheless it was a remarkable and memorable experience and we will most definitely be back next time we are in Vancouver!

We had a wonderful dinner on a Wednesday night. Our server, Danielle (I think) was great. She recommended delicious items and was just the right amount of attentive. We had the beet salad, Brussel sprouts and mushroom pizza. All were terrific.  perhaps the best Brussel sprouts I have ever had. The ambiance was lovely- classy and beautiful.  A great experience

Wow! Wow! Wow! One of the best dinners I ve ever had and I ll never forget it. Most menu items are served family style, so sharing is encouraged. My boyfriend and I enjoyed this aspect since it allowed us to have serval things and split the cost. We started off with the Roasted Brussels Sprouts - simple, yet amazing. Best brussel sprouts I ve ever had and one of the highlights of the night. We then had the Braised Meatballs, which i just found okay, tasted like any other meatball, but my partner loved them. Then for my entree, I had the Arctic Char, which was great. I ve never had that fish before, so I would say it s like salmon. My boyfriend had the braised pork cheek which he says was great as well. Lastly, we had the Banoffee Cake and that was to die for. I would come back just for that alone - absolutely mouthwatering and delicious. This was all worth every pretty penny. I would love to come back to try some of the things we missed. Again, wow!
The food and cocktails are delicious and the service was amazing - Kevan was so friendly, warm and welcoming. Great experience overall!

Great place for celebration or a date night. Ambiance and decor is fantastic. the wait staff is very friendly. We sat at the bar this time and it was really busy. So the service for sitting at the bar was a tad slow. But the food was great. Reasonable prices and nice presentation. Theres lots on the menu to try... meant to share as some of the meat dishes would be too heavy for one person to have all in one sitting. I think the menu changes seasonally if I heard correctly so will def comeback and try some other items we didn t get to try this time around. Highly recommend
